00006 // from solution 2 of the file ~/src/include/cast-const.txt.

00011 #ifndef __TEMPLATES_HH
00012 #define __TEMPLATES_HH
00013 
00014 // Protected Linked List
00015 //
00016 // A linked list with protection against breakage and floating remnants,
00017 // which is also type-safe by using define to create type-specific
00018 // code instead of type-casting from generic code.
00019 // The two classes that are created for each class that uses
00020 // this Protected Linked List template are declared as friends
00021 // of each other, to simplify intuitive processes for such tasks
00022 // as linking and unlinking, without granting any private access to
00023 // either the class using the Protected Linked List template or
00024 // any classes derived from the two additional created classes,
00025 // thereby effectively guarding the link structure against
00026 // changes that could violate the protocol.
00027 /* Schematic of the structure:
00028 
00029    +----+     +----+     +----+     +----+
00030    |obj1|     |obj2|     |obj3|     |obj4|
00031    |inh.|     |inh.|     |inh.|     |inh.|
00032    |PLL |     |PLL |     |PLL |     |PLL |
00033    +----+ next+----+     +----+     +----+
00034 +->|PLL1|<--->|PLL2|<--->|PLL3|<--->|PLL4|<-+
00035 |  +----+prev +----+     +----+     +----+  |
00036 |     \          \         /          /     |   PLL and
00037 |      \__________\_______/__________/      |   PLLRoot
00038 |           root      |                     |   are
00039 |                     v                     |   friends
00040 |         head  +-----------+  tail         |
00041 +---------------|  PLLRoot  |---------------+
00042                 +-----------+
00043                      ### (local, global or new-allocated)
00044         +----------------------------+
00045         | class, function or program |
00046         +----------------------------+
00047 
00048 */
00049 
00050 // a - Protected Linked List class and its Root class, add these
00051 //     above the class header
00052 
00053 template <class PLLType> class PLLRoot;
00054 template <class PLLType>
00055 // <A NAME="PLLHandle"></A>
00056 class PLLHandle { 
00057   friend PLLRoot<PLLType>;
00058   //template<class PLLType> friend PLLRoot; 
00059   enum PLLHandle_Signal { PLL_NOSIGNAL, PLL_LIST_DESTRUCT };
00060 protected: 
00061   PLLRoot<PLLType> * pllroot; 
00062   PLLType * pllnext, * pllprev; 
00063   PLLHandle_Signal pllsignal;
00064   PLLHandle(): pllroot(NULL), pllnext(NULL), pllprev(NULL), pllsignal(PLL_NOSIGNAL) {}
00065   virtual ~PLLHandle() { // virtual destructor calls actual complete most-derived object's destructor first
00066     //cerr << "PLLH=" << (int) this << " next=" << (int) pllnext << " s=" << (int) pllsignal << '\n'; cerr.flush();
00067     if (pllsignal==PLL_LIST_DESTRUCT) { // If pllroot calls deletion, delete from here onwards.
00068       if (pllnext) {
00069         pllnext->pllsignal=PLL_LIST_DESTRUCT;
00070         delete pllnext;
00071       }
00072     } else {
00073       // If un unexpected source calls deletion (e.g. if this element
00074       // was a local object that is destructed) then unlink and
00075       // delete.
00076       isolate();
00077     }
00078   }
00079   inline void isolate(); 
00080 public: 
00081   PLLRoot<PLLType> * Root() const { return pllroot; } 
00082   PLLType * Next() const { return pllnext; } 
00083   PLLType * Prev() const { return pllprev; } 
00084   PLLType * head() const { return pllroot->head(); } 
00085   PLLType * tail() const { return pllroot->tail(); } 
00086   inline PLLType * el(int n) const; 
00087   inline PLLType * seek_head() const; 
00088   inline PLLType * seek_tail() const; 
00089   inline int length() const; 
00090   inline int fulllength() const; 
00091   inline bool unlink_before(PLLRoot<PLLType> & succ); 
00092   inline bool unlink_after(PLLRoot<PLLType> & pred); 
00093   inline void remove(); 
00094 };
00095 
00096 template <class PLLType>
00097 class PLLRoot { 
00098         friend PLLHandle<PLLType>; 
00099         //template<class PLLType> friend PLLHandle; 
00100         protected: 
00101                 PLLType * pllhead; 
00102                 PLLType * plltail; 
00103                 inline void set_root(PLLType * h); 
00104         public: 
00105 /* *** Deletion issue:
00106     Should perhaps enable deletion of a root without deletion of the list, if
00107     it is possible to have multiple roots pointing at the list.
00108 */
00109                 ~PLLRoot() {
00110 //cerr << "PLLR=" << (int) this << " head=" << (int) pllhead << '\n'; cerr.flush();
00111                 clear(); } // *** perhaps also make this virtual, but delete is not usually called on a PLLRoot<PLLType> object
00112                 PLLRoot(): pllhead(NULL), plltail(NULL) {}
00113                 PLLType * head() const { return pllhead; } 
00114                 PLLType * tail() const { return plltail; } 
00115                 PLLType * el(int n) const { if (pllhead) return pllhead->el(n); return NULL; } 
00116                 PLLType * operator[](int n) const { return el(n); } 
00117                 int length() const { if (pllhead) return pllhead->length(); return 0; } 
00118                 inline void update(); 
00119                 inline bool link_before(PLLRoot * succ); 
00120                 inline bool link_before(PLLType * succ); 
00121                 inline bool link_after(PLLRoot * pred); 
00122                 inline bool link_after(PLLType * pred); 
00123                 inline bool insert_after(PLLType * pred, PLLType * inshead); 
00124                 inline bool insert_after(int n, PLLType * inshead); 
00125                 inline bool insert_before(PLLType * succ, PLLType * inshead); 
00126                 inline bool insert_before(int n, PLLType * inshead);
00127                 // *** if the clear() function is for some reason too
00128                 //     drastic, it can be rewritten as follows to require
00129                 //     subsequent manual deletion:
00130                 // PLLRoot<PLLType> * clear() { PLLRoot<PLLType> * clearroot = new PLLRoot<PLLType>; if (pllhead) pllhead->unlink_before(clearroot); return clearroot; }
00131                 void clear() { if (pllhead) pllhead->pllsignal = PLLHandle<PLLType>::PLL_LIST_DESTRUCT; delete pllhead; pllhead = NULL; plltail = NULL; }
00132 };
00133 
00134 // b - Protected Linked List inheritance, add this into the list
00135 //     of inherited classes: public PLLHandle<PLLType>
00136 
00137 // c - Protected Linked List inline functions
00138 //     Note that the static_cast<>()s used below are safe, since
00139 //     it is assured through the creation mechanisms of PLLHandle<PLLType>
00140 //     and PLLRoot<PLLType> that all elements are of the derived class
00141 //     PLLType with base PLLHandle<PLLType>. Also see corresponding
00142 //     <A HREF="../../nnmodels/nnmodels.html">notes</A>.
00143 //     Addendum: The use of static_cast<>() is now avoided as much as
00144 //     possible, since it should not be necessary if the code is
00145 //     properly programmed.
00146 
00147 template <class PLLType>
00148 inline bool PLLHandle<PLLType>::unlink_before(PLLRoot<PLLType> & succ) { 
00149 // unlinks before this and gives this and after
00150 // the new root succ
00151 // succ is currently required to be an empty list
00152         if (succ.head()) return false; 
00153         if (pllprev) pllprev->pllnext = NULL; 
00154  /* *** At this location the simple solution of PLLType * pllnext, etc. does not work.
00155         Using this method, it was necessary to resort to old-style C casting. */
00156         succ.pllhead = (PLLType *) this; 
00157         if (pllroot) { 
00158                 succ.plltail = pllroot->tail(); 
00159                 pllroot->plltail = pllprev; 
00160                 if (!pllprev) pllroot->pllhead = NULL; 
00161         } else succ.plltail = seek_tail(); 
00162         pllprev = NULL; 
00163  /* *** At this location the simple solution of PLLType * pllnext, etc. does not work.
00164         Using this method, it was necessary to resort to old-style C casting. */
00165         succ.set_root((PLLType *) this); 
00166         return true; 
00167 } 
00168 
00169 template <class PLLType>
00170 inline bool PLLHandle<PLLType>::unlink_after(PLLRoot<PLLType> & pred) { 
00171 // unlinks after this and gives this and before
00172 // the new root pred
00173 // pred is currently required to be an empty list
00174         if (pred.head()) return false; 
00175         if (pllnext) pllnext->pllprev = NULL; 
00176  /* *** At this location the simple solution of PLLType * pllnext, etc. does not work.
00177         Using this method, it was necessary to resort to old-style C casting. */
00178         pred.plltail = (PLLType *) this; 
00179         if (pllroot) { 
00180                 pred.pllhead = pllroot->head(); 
00181                 pllroot->pllhead = pllnext; 
00182                 if (!pllnext) pllroot->plltail = NULL; 
00183         } else pred.pllhead = seek_head(); 
00184         pllnext = NULL; 
00185         pred.set_root(pred.head()); 
00186         return true; 
00187 } 
00188 
00189 template <class PLLType>
00190 inline void PLLHandle<PLLType>::isolate() { 
00191 // unlink Protected Linked List element and update head and tail
00192         if (!pllroot) { 
00193                 if (pllprev) pllprev->pllnext = pllnext; 
00194                 if (pllnext) pllnext->pllprev = pllprev;
00195                 pllprev = pllnext = NULL;
00196                 return;
00197         } 
00198         PLLRoot<PLLType> * h = pllroot, r, t; 
00199         unlink_before(t); // t becomes root of this and after
00200         unlink_after(r); // r becomes root of this
00201         h->link_before(&t); // append t to h
00202         // avoid deletion as r is destructed
00203         r.pllhead = NULL; r.plltail = NULL; pllroot = NULL;
00204 } 
00205 
00206 template <class PLLType>
00207 inline void PLLHandle<PLLType>::remove() { 
00208 // unlink and delete Protected Linked List element
00209 // and update head and tail
00210         isolate();
00211         pllsignal = PLL_LIST_DESTRUCT; // an orderly destruct
00212         delete this;
00213 } 
00214 
00215 template <class PLLType>
00216 inline PLLType * PLLHandle<PLLType>::el(int n) const {
00217  /* *** At this location the simple solution of PLLType * pllnext, etc. does not work.
00218         Using this method, it was necessary to resort to old-style C casting. */
00219         if (!n) return (PLLType *) this;
00220         if (n>0) { 
00221                 if (pllnext) return pllnext->el(n-1); 
00222                 else return NULL; 
00223         } else { 
00224                 if (pllprev) return pllprev->el(n+1); 
00225                 else return NULL; 
00226         } 
00227 } 
00228 
00229 template <class PLLType>
00230 inline PLLType * PLLHandle<PLLType>::seek_head() const { 
00231  /* *** At this location the simple solution of PLLType * pllnext, etc. does not work.
00232         Using this method, it was necessary to resort to old-style C casting. */
00233         if (!pllprev) return (PLLType *) this;
00234         return pllprev->seek_head(); 
00235 } 
00236 
00237 template <class PLLType>
00238 inline PLLType * PLLHandle<PLLType>::seek_tail() const { 
00239  /* *** At this location the simple solution of PLLType * pllnext, etc. does not work.
00240         Using this method, it was necessary to resort to old-style C casting. */
00241         if (!pllnext) return (PLLType *) this; 
00242         return pllnext->seek_tail(); 
00243 } 
00244 
00245 template <class PLLType>
00246 inline int PLLHandle<PLLType>::length() const { 
00247         if (Next()) return 1 + Next()->length(); 
00248         return 1; 
00249 } 
00250 
00251 template <class PLLType>
00252 inline int PLLHandle<PLLType>::fulllength() const { 
00253         return head()->length(); 
00254 } 
00255 
00256 template <class PLLType>
00257 inline void PLLRoot<PLLType>::set_root(PLLType * h) { 
00258         for (; (h); h = h->Next()) h->pllroot = this; 
00259 } 
00260 
00261 template <class PLLType>
00262 inline void PLLRoot<PLLType>::update() { 
00263 // clears head and tail if elements were linked to another root
00264 // or fixes head and tail if either one pointed to an element with
00265 // a different root
00266         if (pllhead) if (pllhead->Root()!=this) pllhead = NULL; 
00267         if (plltail) { 
00268                 if (plltail->Root()!=this) { 
00269                         if (!pllhead) plltail = NULL; 
00270                         else plltail = pllhead->seek_tail(); 
00271                 } else { 
00272                         if (!pllhead) pllhead = plltail->seek_head(); 
00273                 } 
00274         } 
00275 } 
00276 
00277 template <class PLLType>
00278 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::link_before(PLLRoot<PLLType> * succ) {
00279 // Links the tail of this to the head of succ, then makes this the
00280 // root of elements previously belonging to succ
00281         if (!succ) return false; 
00282         if (!succ->head()) return false; 
00283         // *** could call update() here first to insure that pllhead and plltail
00284         //     are correct
00285         if (plltail) { 
00286                 plltail->pllnext = succ->head(); 
00287                 succ->head()->pllprev = plltail; 
00288         } else pllhead = succ->head(); 
00289         plltail = succ->tail(); 
00290         set_root(succ->head()); 
00291         succ->update(); 
00292         return true; 
00293 } 
00294 
00295 template <class PLLType>
00296 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::link_before(PLLType * succ) { 
00297 // when succ->Root()==NULL, this allows previously
00298 // unprotected lists or newly created PLLType elements
00299 // to be linked
00300         if (!succ) return false; 
00301         if (succ->Root()) return link_before(succ->Root()); 
00302         if (plltail) { 
00303                 plltail->pllnext = succ;
00304                 succ->pllprev = plltail; 
00305         } else pllhead = succ; 
00306         plltail = succ; // *** this may need to be succ->seek_tail(), unless lists without root cannot exist
00307         set_root(succ); 
00308         return true; 
00309 } 
00310 
00311 template <class PLLType>
00312 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::link_after(PLLRoot<PLLType> * pred) { 
00313         if (!pred) return false; 
00314         if (!pred->tail()) return false; 
00315         // *** could call update() here first to insure that pllhead and plltail
00316         //     are correct
00317         if (pllhead) { 
00318                 pllhead->pllprev = pred->tail(); 
00319                 pred->tail()->pllnext = pllhead; 
00320         } else plltail = pred->head(); 
00321         pllhead = pred->head(); 
00322         set_root(pred->head()); 
00323         pred->update(); 
00324         return true; 
00325 }
00326 
00327 template <class PLLType>
00328 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::link_after(PLLType * pred) { 
00329 // when succ->Root()==NULL, this allows previously
00330 // unprotected lists or newly created PLLType elements
00331 // to be linked
00332         if (!pred) return false; 
00333         if (pred->Root()) return link_after(pred->Root()); 
00334         if (pllhead) { 
00335                 pllhead->pllprev = pred; 
00336                 pred->pllnext = pllhead; 
00337         } else plltail = pred; 
00338         pllhead = pred;  // *** this may need to be pred->seek_head(), unless lists without root cannot exist
00339         set_root(pred); 
00340         return true; 
00341 }
00342 
00343 template <class PLLType>
00344 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::insert_after(PLLType * pred, PLLType * inshead) {
00345 // inserts inshead after element pred in this list
00346 // if pred==NULL or pred->Root()!=this, inserts at tail of list
00347         if (!pred) return link_before(inshead); // link inshead to tail of this
00348         if (pred->Root()!=this) return link_before(inshead); // link inshead to tail of this
00349         PLLRoot<PLLType> h;
00350         pred->unlink_after(h); // get head of list up to pred into h
00351         bool res = h.link_before(inshead); // link inshead to tail of h
00352         link_after(&h); // link h to head of this
00353         return res;
00354 } 
00355 
00356 template <class PLLType>
00357 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::insert_after(int n, PLLType * inshead) {
00358 // inserts inshead after the nth element in this list
00359 // if nth element does not exist, inserts at tail of list
00360         PLLType * pred = el(n);
00361         return insert_after(pred,inshead);
00362 } 
00363 
00364 template <class PLLType>
00365 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::insert_before(PLLType * succ, PLLType * inshead) {
00366 // inserts inshead before element succ in this list
00367 // if succ==NULL or succ->Root()!=this, inserts at head of list
00368         if (!succ) return link_after(inshead); // link inshead to head of this
00369         if (succ->Root()!=this) return link_after(inshead); // link inshead to head of this
00370         PLLRoot<PLLType> t;
00371         succ->unlink_before(t); // get tail of list from succ into t
00372         bool res = t.link_after(inshead); // link inshead to head of t
00373         link_before(&t); // link t to tail of this
00374         return res;
00375 } 
00376 
00377 template <class PLLType>
00378 inline bool PLLRoot<PLLType>::insert_before(int n, PLLType * inshead) {
00379 // inserts inshead before the nth element in this list
00380 // if nth element does not exist, inserts at head of list
00381         PLLType * succ = el(n);
00382         return insert_before(succ,inshead);
00383 }

00385 // d - Protected Linked List macro that can be used to
00386 //     access functions in linked elements at a relative
00387 //     distance n from an element
00388 #define Protected_Linked_List_Indexed_Access(PLLType,Here,There) \
00389         if (!n) return Here; \
00390         if (PLLType * e = el(n)) return e->There; else return NULL \
00391 
00392 // e - Protected Linked List macro that loops forward through
00393 //     linked elements contingent upon a test, providing the
00394 //     pointer e to the current element
00395 #define PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(PLLType,Init_El,Extra_Test) \
00396         for (PLLType * e = Init_El; ((e) && (Extra_Test)); e = e->Next())
00397 
00398 // f - Protected Linked List macro that loops forward through
00399 //     linked elements contingent upon a test, providing the
00400 //     pointer to the current element in a specified variable
00401 //     to enable nesting of PLL_LOOP_FORWARD_NESTED calls
00402 #define PLL_LOOP_FORWARD_NESTED(PLLType,Init_El,Extra_Test,RefVar) \
00403         for (PLLType * RefVar = Init_El; ((RefVar) && (Extra_Test)); RefVar = RefVar->Next())
